Name: Flames of Heart
QuestDesc: The curtain has fallen on the grand competitions. Don your medal and travel onward to the Vale of Glory, where you shall make a decision that may change how the story goes.

Unlock.Name: Fantastic Ta-das and Where to Find Them

Chapters.Title: Go to the arena and meet up with Lupa
Go to the arena and meet up with Lupa

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've come, warrior!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mighty guardian, our Iudicis Arsinosa, is not the kind of Echo to warm to crowds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Lioness favors the strong, the unyielding, and the battle-hardened. Only those she deems worthy will find her arms welcoming.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... she is still an Echo and can't talk.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (These sounds...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is it? Did you feel something just now?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I only heard strange sounds. Tell me, what direction did the Lioness just look toward?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The <te href=850160>Vale of Glory</te>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's where all heroes, blessed by the glory forged in iron and fire, find their rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But on the long path of hunting, many died with their bodies missing. Only their weapons returned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arsinosa's frequency is woven from the cries of souls in battle. The battered weapons still carry the will of their former masters, whispering the deeds left undone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To touch such weapons is a rite of great importance for those who claim glory in the Great Agon and receive the Lioness's blessing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hearing the voices of our ancestors by Arsinosa's side is a great source of strength for Septimontians.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Before meeting Buling, when I touched the Echo in that village, I felt... a layered, indistinct frequency.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (It was like what Abby described on our journey to Septimont, but the source eluded me at the time.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But now... I've found it.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The source of that power lies in the Vale of Glory. The closer the Lioness gets to it, the clearer it becomes.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She waits for us there. Shall we go together?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not sure if Septimontian rituals will interest you, but you might uncover something useful, no?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm happy to go with my fellow warrior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perfect! Let's head out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing... just...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Just a dizzy spell. Overexcitement after the win... or something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, it's no matter. Let's continue.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The Lioness of Glory Arsinosa gives you and Lupa her blessing. As your hand touches the Guardian, you once again feel that strange energy emanate from her.

With Arsinosa's recognition, you follow her to the Vale of Glory, the resting place of Septimont's heroes—the source of the abnormal energy you felt.

Chapters.Title: Go to the Vale of Glory

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These days have been a feast of victories!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Becoming champion, the glory... All thanks to you.

Chapters.Title: Go to the Vale of Glory

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strange... Why are so many appearing all at once?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought Tacet Discords didn't usually appear around the Border Mountains.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (These Tacet Discords didn't gather from the surroundings. It's more like... they spawned from thin air.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, it's just ahead. The Vale of Glory, where heroes are laid to rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... are...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From my homeland...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Septimont...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That girl just now... that was Mya.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The closer to the Vale of Glory, the more the normal world and the anomaly overlap. Whatever lies ahead must be the key to all of this.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I need to rethink everything. Septimont, Lupa, Cartethyia, Mya, the Lioness of Glory... all of it.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Cartethyia arrived in Septimont alone, not waiting for me or attempting contact. Something must have happened to prevent her.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (If something cut her off, aside from the Fractsidus, it could've only been the Threnodian, which should be dead.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But Septimont holds no faith in the Sentinel, and the Threnodian was never able to establish influence here. Hmm... maybe it's not that simple.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The Threnodian controls the minds of Its followers through their faith. Mya is a Ragunnesi, and likely a follower of The Order of the Deep.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (If the Vale of Glory is an important rite for champions, perhaps Mya went there... and it was there she vanished.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Her hysterics, hallucinations, and loss of control in the arena were signs of the Threnodian's corruption.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Phrolova once said, "The closer one stands to the protagonist, the greater their influence over the tale."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (In this Great Agon, Lupa is the protagonist. Years ago, it was Mya. Now, I'm seeing Mya's image flicker in and out throughout this journey.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (If the Mya I see is under the Threnodian's control, does that mean securing the protagonist role is key to Its plan?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (When I first met Lupa, I sensed what felt like Cartethyia's frequency on her. Later, I also felt the Threnodian's presence.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Did they cross paths? If Cartethyia is part of this story, the likelihood is high.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Could Lupa have forgotten? Did they meet without realizing it? Or is she lying and already under the Threnodian's influence?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Was Phrolova telling the truth by saying Lupa would bring forth the Dark Tide... or is she just another one of its victims?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? Hey, is something wrong?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is there something you need? Or... something you want to say?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry. I don't recall crossing paths with Cartethyia. But... you could be right. I may have, and just forgotten about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These past days, there have been moments when... I feel lost, forgetting what I was doing a heartbeat ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know if it's the Threnodian's work, but... if something is wrong, and it's trying to twist my mind...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'd make the right call. Wouldn't you, my fellow warrior?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'd protect my honor and my dignity.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's more at stake than that, Lupa.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've heard the Septimont saying, "All for glory, fear no death." But sometimes, living takes more courage than dying.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, well then, that'll do just fine!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I trust you, warrior, just as you trust me.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay, don't worry about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Is that so?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know what's weighing on your mind, but you accepted my invitation, and we fought as one in the arena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As a warrior, I trust the clash of steel far more than words!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The traces of the blade reflect the soul of its wielder.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright! Don't wear that face. Whatever it is, I trust you'll make the right call.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Septimont is my city. Don't let it lose its glory or pride. Will you promise me that, warrior?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll do what I can.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (It doesn't matter if the story's end is already written, or yet to unfold...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I'll trust my own judgment to guide it where it must go.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You begin to piece together everything you've learned about Septimont, Lupa, Cartethyia, Mya, the Dark Tide, and Arsinosa.

No matter how this carefully crafted story ends, you will act to correct its course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those blades, spears, and halberd embedded in the stone... they're the weapons of the fallen heroes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have a tradition in Septimont. Touch them and listen to the whispers of those who once wielded them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stretching out your hand, your fingertips brush against the rusted steel. A deep, solemn voice hums from the spear's shaft.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Through endless battles and the surging Dark Tide, kin and warmth were lost, and all softness and love faded away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All that remained in his eyes was the sight of white flowers blooming across barren fields.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How fragile, how beautiful... He sighed as his skull was crushed under the Tacet Discord's weight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stretching out your hand, your fingertips brush against the rusted steel. A quiet, sorrowful voice hums from the halberd's axe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one knew why she sought the battlefield, only to escape another.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She shed her gold, tore away the honor binding her, and turned her back on the proud House that shackled her, rejecting the eyes that followed her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "This silence... it is my victory!" She laughed, charging into the Dark Tide.

Chapters.Title: Listen to the whispering of the ancient sword

Options.PlotLineKey: Who did this blade belong to?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is Tercules's sword. You remember the waters of the upper city, right? You were looking for Cartethyia. Tercules was the one that the statue was based on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ages ago, the Dark Tide bore down on Ragunnesi, and Septimont didn't escape.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tercules was the son of the Ephor back then, and he led our warriors to face the Tacet Discords. He died in that cursed Tide, his strength worn down to nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His sword was corrupted, but his followers still risked their lives to bring it back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In this land, intense emotions easily blend with other forces. The Lioness of Glory was born from the fiery passions of heroes, so she holds sway over their weapons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then, this sword was growing more sinister due to the corruption...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But all these years later, it has become a memento of a hero.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I feel something strong and pulsing in the direction the blade is pointing.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (It's coming from underground. Is it inside the mountain itself?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...The frequency... it's the Sentinel Imperator...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like Ragunna, Septimont has its own Genesis Nexus... That's why It seeks...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Power... needs more...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
When you touch the sword of Tercules, a Septimontian hero, Cartethyia's voice abruptly rings through the air.

Just as suddenly, the world around you falls once again into anomaly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More Tacet Discords! Just like last time!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (For a split second, the world shifted. Just like it did when I saw Mya.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Every time there's an overlap like this, the Tidal Blight appears, as well as Tacet Discords...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tidal Blight... It's an outgrowth of the Dark Tide itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why is it appearing suddenly like this...?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll clear it out first, then check if that sword is the source.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's that sound... Come, we should check it out!

Chapters.Title: Go to the source of the strange sound

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This... doesn't feel like the first time I've been here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's no mistaking it now. It's Imperator's frequency.
Thou...
Thou carry the scent of Cartethyia.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not just knowledge...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've stolen the Sentinel's access too!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa's role in this story...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't yours!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that... Contender Mya?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa, this is something only you can do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tell me what I need to do.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Read the script. Adapt as required.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe in you, warrior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To lose our strength...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is the deepest fear of Septimontians.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pride hides the terror within.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We fear no death,

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet tremble before shame and failure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did Domina Julia deceive me for this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never got the chance to ask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide consumed all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Death took her...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As it will take me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Today, as yesterday...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We weave time beneath the tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Swim, swim!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wretched yet lovely fish!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dream deeply in my fiction,

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On the stage of a repeating tale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Waiting for the day thou shalt consume the world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O Righteous One!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I shall depart without a word.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The golden city in my childhood legend,

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is swallowed by the abhorrent tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I whisper to my fleeting companion,

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pages will scatter, the quill will fall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This play shall be torn from its author's hands!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A wrong note in the shifting score.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O Golden Star, full of mercy,

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pray, tell me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As past and present intertwine,

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What fate,

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you chosen?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hesitate not, warrior.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are the protagonist I have chosen.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only you can shatter the script.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And jump to the next page.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Write.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For the nobility you seek,

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For it all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha... huff... Ugh!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A-a dream? No, it couldn't...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's no dream.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not alone. The Warrior put the hope of change in my hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh... This feels good. Not standing there alone on the champion's stage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ({PlayerName} hasn't learned this yet, but I now remember traveling with Cartethyia. I can't be in the real world.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This is a Sonoro created by the Fractsidus. It's a realm of stories.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The story of the Great Agon lasts only three days. Before Cartethyia came here, I... had wandered this same bloody story more times than I can count.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The Dark Tide consumes Septimont, and that monstrous half-human, half-sea creature grows ever larger... Is this the Fractsidus plan? To feed it with Septimont's ruins?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (A script... Yes, this Sonoro is like a book of plays.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Each world in the Sonoro is a story that keeps repeating, like sheets of paper, all overlapping with one another.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (New pages keep appearing, layering over the old, and the changes in one story bleed through to the next.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (After Cartethyia's actions, Septimont, once destroyed by the Dark Tide, has begun to return to normal in the story where {PlayerName} arrived.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Cartethyia saved me, changed my fate, and led me to the Warrior, who stopped the Threnodian in the last story. So in this time, I haven't lost my memory.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ({PlayerName} had delivered a powerful blow against the monster, and the energy supply from the Central Hub has been cut off.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But that's not even its full form...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I once searched for its true form with Cartethyia. I remember now, what we seek lies in the lower city's waters.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I won't let your trust be misplaced, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Lupa wakes near the Central Hub. All at once, she remembers everything. Cartethyia, the fall of Septimont, and the Realm of Plays.

The story is starting again. Lupa steels herself and heads toward the monstrosity possessed by the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The Old District of Septimont, submerged beneath the waters due to the Dark Tide...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Ah. The Dark Tide looms over Septimont like a stubborn storm cloud.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Is {PlayerName}... No, no time to worry. I have to find the cause of all this, and quickly.）

Chapters.Title: Ride the Wingray high up to the sky

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa arrives at the flooded Old District, the waters stirring memories of when she once walked these streets with Cartethyia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (In a past story, I came here with Cartethyia...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look at you... you can't go on much longer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I feared as much. Then this is where we... stop.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strange. I remember everything about Septimont, but... I can't remember... I can't even remember my name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You didn't forget.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone stole your role in the story. Even your name on the placards in the arena would be unreadable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your existence has been erased. Only by unmaking this story can it be reclaimed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Too bad I won't last long enough to see that happen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry, Cartethyia. You saved me, but I can't help you in return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I was a child... long ago, I heard tales of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A city full of passion and life. People there drank deeply, laughed loudly, appreciated sculpture, and lived for the hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Men and women feared nothing. They burned like fire, giving all their light and heat before fading.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But when I arrived in Septimont, it had already been undone by dark hands. With the Dark Tide sweeping the streets, the city was nothing but an empty shell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right... my city is beautiful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the autumn wind blew through the golden flags and wind chimes, time seemed to slow...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Leviathan... I will not give It the chance to make the people of Rinascita weep and bleed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will drag whoever orchestrated this tragedy out of the shadows.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Septimont... can I leave it to you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You said it yourself. This is your city. Some things, only you can do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The monster leaving its trace in the Dark Tide... I can feel it. Its frequency is similar to my own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian created me to be a Resonator for Its power. But I wasn't the only one. Many "vessels" before me failed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is still much I don't know. I'll keep searching. But no matter what, you have a certain "specialness."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once... I sought to end it all. Someone stopped me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even a life mocked by fate can break its curse. Whatever you seek to do, whether you're weak or strong, you must strive for it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I returned to the world thanks to a certain person's help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe {Male=he;Female=she} will come here and reshape this twisted story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Must be quite the person, eh? I wish I could meet {Male=him;Female=her}... and see how {Male=he;Female=she} does it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then you will see for yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Victory isn't won in an instant. It takes patience and perseverance. What we can't do now, someone will carry forward later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you want to save your city, then hold on. No matter the pain, no matter the doubts, you must keep going.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like how you wandered Septimont before I came, broken yet determined to leave to find help for the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jump to a new story, and bring my message to that person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, Cartethyia... I'll... I'll try my best...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: First... tell me, what is that person's name?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm close to that abnormal frequency...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...You're in the submerged aqueducts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Lupa and Cartethyia's journey together comes to an end when Lupa is "erased" from the story. But before she vanished, Cartethyia imparts a frequency that binds Lupa's fate with yours.

Cartethyia confirms that the creature she's hunting is hiding deep within Septimont's underground waterways.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The submerged aqueducts... I remember reading about them in the Silva records. There used to be an underground waterway leading to the plains.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now, with the Old District completely flooded, we can only access it if we drain the water first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (After my role was erased, Cartethyia must've found the half-human, half-sea creature... and the Fractsidus.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Like {PlayerName}, she chose to remain on the closing of that page. To give new stories a fighting chance.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That's why... I only regained my name after I met the Warrior.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (During our journey, the overlapping worlds the Warrior saw were the monster's doing. It tried to use Mya to steal my role again... to corrupt Septimont once more.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Only I can erase it from this story. Only I can prove that I'm real, and it is fake.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...What happened to the Mya who vanished in the Vale of Glory decades ago?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After everything you went through, what did the city of Septimont mean to you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa resolves to drain the Old District's flooded streets to reach the underground waterway where the monster waits. With you and Cartethyia's hopes resting on her, she seeks the truth behind Mya's disappearance decades ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I remember the entrance to the underground waterway is in the Old Districts Bell Tower.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Ah... Of course! The upkeep of these waters always falls under the Silvas' jurisdiction.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Maybe I can awaken this sleeping Giant of Glory.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (In Septimontian tradition, when it bears its blade and watches over the warriors leaving for the hunt, all gates and passages open.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Many of the old routes are blocked, but I can try draining the water through the remaining ones. It's worth a try!)

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa decides to use the Giant of Glory to drain the water from the Old District and enter the underground waterway.

Chapters.Title: Drain the submerged areas of the Old District
Take the elevator to reach the underground waterway

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Just this gate standing between me and the heart of the aqueducts.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (It won't open... I'll have to find another route.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The copper mirror is calling.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The Warrior used it to "see" the past. I wonder if there's anything of that here...)

Chapters.Title: Use the Copper Mirror of Truth
Watch what the Copper Mirror reveals

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've already pulled that body from the sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excellent, Domina Julia. Keeping one's word is the foundation of any solid partnership.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know, I know. Septimont's current Ephor doesn't quite heed the Senate's wishes, but we'll see to that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A cup of poisoned wine, a passing fly, a dagger... fate strikes where least expected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With someone as clever and calculated as you at the helm, the House of Silva need not fear for its survival.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do not work with you for our sake! I do this for Septimont!

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Some of us have forgotten the terror of life adrift at sea. To survive the tide, one must make the right choices.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll speak of other matters later. But tell me, why would you want a dead woman who fell into the sea?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dead woman... Ah, you mean Mya?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed, she is the very heart of the unit I spoke of. The one we intend to build deep within these underground aqueducts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alive or dead, her body holds the information we need. The Fractsidus's experiments here will continue for some time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the meantime, covering up this little laboratory's existence will require your assistance, madam.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...The heart? That weakling's Resonance abilities were meager at best. Her performance in the arena was nothing special.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph, if it weren't for those incompetent fools in the Senate using her as a puppet to shift the attention and anger of the masses, she wouldn't even have made it to the finals!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do not be upset, my dear Domina. You are absolutely right. The girl is so feeble she can't resist her creator's will in the slightest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Winning the Grand Agon was precisely what brought the shadow of death upon her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Luck and misfortune, nobility and lowliness, weakness and strength... A person's nature is like two sides of a coin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I've always found beauty in inevitable tragedies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The copper mirror reveals Julia striking a deal with the Playwright to recover Mya's remains, the same Mya who fell into the sea decades ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...So Mya has been dead all this time...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She didn't leave Septimont when she vanished... The sea took her.

Chapters.Title: Use the Copper Mirror of Truth
Watch what the Copper Mirror reveals

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I trust you've seen the experimental unit in the aqueducts. Well, what do you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If not for the sword embedded in her chest, I could mistake the corpse for being alive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. Decades have passed, yet Mya remains as she was when first pulled from the sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her data has been invaluable. As the Threnodian's failed Resonator, this... specimen is, in its own way, remarkable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know, it wasn't so long ago that {PlayerName} intervened and Cartethyia broke free from that tower.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I discovered that a small piece of the Threnodian's essence within Mya was reawakened with the tower's resurgence into our world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sounds as though you've found new inspiration.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, Septimont will host the Great Agon soon. I've come up with a rather intriguing idea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before her death, Mya also attended the tournament. I'll use that as the fictitious anchor to craft a play to rewrite reality itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've already discussed terms with It and reached a modest agreement.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...You spoke with the Threnodian? Has Leviathan already awakened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only a fragment of It remains. A weakened, cunning shard, desperate to grow stronger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll fashion a story for this sea creature, enabling it to fulfill what It once sought: to have the Dark Tide swallow Septimont whole.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian once sought to use Mya to find Septimont's Central Hub in order to corrupt the Beacon system. Even if met with failure, It would control the champion's mind to infiltrate the city's upper echelons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh well! It all failed in the end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the face of her futility to resist corruption, that girl chose death. She drove a sword into her heart and leapt into the sea before choking on her own blood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fascinating, isn't it? Faced with the same predicament, strength and weakness still make a difference.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Blessed Maiden singlehandedly thwarted the Threnodian's designs in Ragunna, but this poor soul had no choice but to take her own life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A death so theatrical, so saturated with sorrow… How poetic, how beautifully tragic…

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't care for your taste, Cristoforo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm merely curious. What ending have you penned for Septimont this time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, such an impatient reader, Phrolova.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This play is nothing more than an "amplifier," designed to nurture the Threnodian's lingering power. Once it grows large enough, I'll overlay the Sonoro onto reality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All that's needed is for Domina Julia to select the right champion. Heh, swapping out the protagonist is hardly a challenge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once the sea creature grows within the cradle I've forged from the Dark Tide, the hymn of "Journeying Paradise" will spread from Septimont across Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really, compared to those Septimontians who've long forgotten Mya, the story I've written for her is far more thrilling! Don't you agree?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And what if it fails?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then so be it. You know, Phrolova, stories are but mankind's attempt to imagine and rehearse fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If this play proves {PlayerName} worthy of becoming the protagonist of my story, if they pass their trial by fire, then isn't that a victory as well?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The copper mirror reveals Phrolova speaking with the Playwright. Mya was the Threnodian's creation who resisted Its control by throwing herself into the sea two decades ago.

After the events at the Inverted Tower, Leviathan's lingering power sought refuge in Mya's corpse, allowing the Playwright to make contact with the Threnodian and begin their machinations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Disgusting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To treat Septimont like a plaything... unforgivable!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's so poetic or romantic about a story where someone is driven to death?

Chapters.Title: Use the Copper Mirror of Truth

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still lingering, Mya?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A fading Reverberation that should have dissolved in the deep long ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Where... are you going...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To claim the title.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was that not your unfulfilled wish?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That... was never... mine... the arena...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... don't... need... this... victory...!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I do. Without a champion and the Lion Beast, I cannot touch the Central Hub left by Imperator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... Cartethyia, both my "daughters," my very creations! Why this fruitless resistance?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Has Septimont ever granted you kindness?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They neither love you nor need you. Long have you been forgotten.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were... raised... by... them...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... will never... understand...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Proud in battle, and yet yearning for strength. I know the heart of the Septimontians far better than you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mya, you are simply too afraid to face their true nature. You choose to deceive yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You cannot admit that they used you and then cast you aside. You cannot accept that, from the start, you were insignificant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... Viburnum... my... flowers...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hush. It matters not. Your thoughts are of little consequence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The copper mirror reveals the Lady of the Sea, Mya's Threnodian-corrupted remains, speaking with a lingering Reverberation of Mya's soul.

Seeing Its "daughter" continue to stubbornly reject Its control, the Lady of the Sea grows displeased and silences her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Viburnum... the Bloodleaf Viburnum of Septimont?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Ah. I understand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a flower often given to Gladiators... a symbol of victory.

Chapters.Title: Take the elevator to reach the depths of the waterway

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I've always carried this shame.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Shame for something I didn't choose, shame for something that's just there. Sometimes, it turns into doubt.）

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I try to live free! And I do, most days. But still...  I see it. I see the pain in their faces.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (In the ones who fall behind. The ones who leave the field beaten. The ones who pin all their hopes on me...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I've always wondered, if I didn't have this gift, could I... could I've reached this point with clean hands?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Should I have judged those who trample the rules to survive? Was I blind to my own arrogance?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now... I don't think like that anymore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName} is stronger than me, no doubt, but {Male=he;Female=she} treats everyone the same. {Male=He;Female=She} didn't choose to stand alone. Instead, {Male=he;Female=she} chose to trust me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia spent years trapped by the weight of everyone's expectations. Never stepped foot in Septimont before, but still sailed across the seas to be here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And Mya... Her Resonance ability might be weak, but she never ran from a fight. She fought 'til her last breath.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A heart isn't shaped by what it's born with or what it's been given.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've underestimated others... and I've underestimated myself, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you! Arrogance! Thinking you understand the darkness in people's hearts. But you don't have a single drop of life in you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beautiful as ever, the <te href=850150>Gryphon's Fortress</te>. My city, Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Built by the hands of the people. Not the Sentinel, and not the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where there's light, there's always shadow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But people need light. They'll chase it no matter what. And they'll learn to live with the shadow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mya, Cartethyia… They were born and raised on these islands. They are daughters of Rinascita. They belong to no gods but their own!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The confusion that has churned in Lupa's heart begins to ease, thanks to you, Cartethyia, and Mya. The light of clarity strengthens her resolve into a keen edge.

She raises her spear at the awakened Lady of the Sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I swear by the eternal sun, I will slay you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From the fear and the longings of civilization, I was wrought, born of the hearts of countless men and women, of babes and of the aged.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With sharp blades and silver tongue, you struggle for power and revel in the slaughter of the arena. From past to present, nothing has changed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha! What right do you have to judge the people of Rinascita?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mya chose her end with dignity. Your very existence is an insult to her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look at you, cowering in this little incubator, desperate to evade your end. You will never understand what it takes to face the fear of death!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady of the Sea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A human life is nothing more than a scream between life and death!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Burn to dust!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greatness has no summit, and victory is never the final word.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Proud?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pitiful?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cry!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Laugh!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Race to the finish,

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To face death with the crown of glory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By my will,

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let this life burn in all its fury!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa & Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...To me, there is no greater joy in this world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a shame. It seems the play I've written isn't well received.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What are you two plotting in Rinascita?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dear madam...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's leave some mystery for the next chapter, shall we?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa!

Chapters.Title: Follow the Lady of the Sea and access "The Finale"

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's real… Both of you are safe!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian's frequency is gone. Well done, Lupa.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've found {PlayerName} and safeguarded Septimont... It's like something out of a knight's tale. Hmm, no, wait... Gladiator's tale?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew! Finally, I can stick my head out! {PlayerName}, are you okay?!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm fine, Abby. What happened to you earlier?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I… wait, we're already in Septimont?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was just talking to you, and then boom! It felt like something just... covered me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: First, it messed with my frequency, then... I just passed out. Wait! Cartethyia? And a girl I don't know?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, you're lively. Your Echo's more boisterous than a Ta-da!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-what happened while I was out?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I think it's time we compare notes. Let's fill in this story's blanks, shall we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You, Cartethyia, and Lupa reunite and exchange the truths you've learned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I sensed the Threnodian's power here in Septimont, I immediately set out to find its source.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was quite sudden. I slipped through the smallest of cracks to enter this Sonoro, which severed my contact with the outside world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I found Lupa in the city. She had lost her role.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We traveled together for a time and discovered the architects of the destruction—the Fractsidus playwright Cristoforo and the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sadly, the playwright did eventually erase Lupa's existence. As for me, I descended into the submerged aqueducts where I found the Threnodian. It had inhabited Mya's remains and was hiding within an experimental unit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unfortunately, I was unable to eliminate it entirely. It evaded me, slipping into hiding.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I reasoned that you would sense the anomaly and come to Septimont, so I sought to offer you my aid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I battled the playwright, and in doing so, stripped him of his ability to control the script.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Afterward, he, along with the other Fractsidus Overseers, fled from me. With that, the Sonoro began to collapse. It was then that we finally met.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is there anything else you wish to ask, {PlayerName}?

Options.PlotLineKey: Tell me about these <color=RedD>roles and stories</color>.
Tell me about the Threnodian and the Central Hub.
Tell me about the other Fractsidus leaders.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa and I formed a few theories during our investigation, though they may not be entirely accurate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In this Sonoro, where stories manifest as reality, roles define the identities of those within it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To lose your role is to lose both your name and memory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In truth, Mya has long since passed and does not truly exist here. It was Lupa, not Mya, who won the three-day Agon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suspect the stories created by the playwright cannot stray too far from their original frameworks. A limitation of his Resonance ability.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is why he erased Lupa's name, swapping her and "Mya's" identities. This allowed Mya to summon the Dark Tide upon Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Central Hub within the Vale of Glory was established by the Sentinel, and it appears no one had ever entered it before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Activating it requires two key conditions. Victory, which grants the blessing bestowed by the Lioness of Glory through the Sentinel's mandate, and a trace of the Sentinel's frequency.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian set Its sights on Mya for this very reason, which in turn brought Its attention to Lupa.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I struck a significant blow to the Threnodian within the story, but because I failed to prevent the corruption of the Central Hub earlier. It endured, drawing strength from that source.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Throughout this journey, I often saw the figures of Lupa and Mya overlap…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems the Threnodian was attempting to replace Lupa, hoping to use her to corrupt the Hub, siphon its power, and ultimately destroy Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apart from the playwright, I also encountered two other Fractsidus leaders. One, a woman with a bandaged eye, the other a man with scars across his face.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Surely they must be Phrolova and... Scar. But how is Scar in Rinascita?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unfortunately, I never had the chance to confront either of them directly. I saw them only briefly before they disappeared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not sure why they've gathered here in Septimont. We must prepare for whatever plans they have.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian's frequency has vanished from Septimont, but I fear this is far from over.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is something else. Perhaps due to the Dark Tide in the Sonoro, I can feel my balance shifting... The Threnodian's pull is growing stronger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that I think of it, this could very well be part of the Fractsidus's plan.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...You need to head to the Black Shores, Cartethyia.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They've been dealing with the Threnodian for years. You should go there and run some tests. They'll know how to handle what's coming.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores... Is that where you're from?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it's a place you trust, then I will go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The event that brought forth the Dark Tide... it must have been my death.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After that, the details of the story blur. It repeated so many times. It's hard to remember everything...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All I remember is wandering the desolate city streets in a Septimont corrupted by the Dark Tide, unable to escape... until I met Cartethyia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She saved me. But in that story, we couldn't fully resolve the source of the disaster.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then in another story, I encountered you, my fellow warrior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After we parted, I awoke in yet another story, in the Vale of Glory where I finally saw the Threnodian's true form in the submerged aqueducts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It... had taken control of Mya's corpse and was using the Fractsidus's Sonoro to grow Its power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After defeating It, the Sonoro began to collapse. I passed through those crumbling pages to find you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is there anything else you want to know? I'll hold nothing back.

Options.PlotLineKey: Tell me about your journey with Cartethyia.
Tell me about Mya and the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My "death"... Well, I'll start from the very beginning: My journey to win the championship.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I had failed to expose the family's match-fixing. After being deceived by Domina Julia and winning the title on my own, my memories became a blur... I was probably under some form of control.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The last thing I clearly remembered was standing in the Central Hub in the Vale of Glory, pressing my spear into something that resembled a control panel. Then the Dark Tide began to surge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the end, all of Septimont was swallowed by it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not sure when all this started, or where the line between the reality I knew and the Sonoro world created by the Fractsidus began to blur.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In those three days of the story where Cartethyia didn't rescue me, I would always die on the first day, helplessly watching as my home slowly crumbled to dust.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia saved me—the me who had lost her role and her memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We wandered the abandoned city of Septimont and pieced together that the Fractsidus and the Threnodian were the true architects of the chaos.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet in the end, my role was claimed by the Threnodian, and my body disappeared before Cartethyia's eyes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But before I was lost to oblivion, Cartethyia gave me a sliver of her frequency…

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think it was that frequency that unknowingly led to our paths crossing in the story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Many years ago... Mya cast herself into the sea to escape the Threnodian's control.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Domina Julia recovered her broken body from the depths and handed it over to the Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For years, they subjected her remains to twisted experiments until the Threnodian's essence, still lingering within her, finally awakened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian took control of Mya's corpse, turning it into a half-human, half-sea creature monstrosity. It formed an alliance with the Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The last trace of Mya's Reverberation was forced to be part of It, tortured and ravaged...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, the script and the copper mirror you gave me! I'll return them to you now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was a long story, but the ending turned out well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though, thinking of Mya still upsets me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her Reverberations, trapped in that monstrous body... I can't imagine her suffering over the last twenty years...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When you defeated the Threnodian, you also set her free.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Yes. It was an honor to have that final battle with her!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to you and Cartethyia, I was able to rewrite the tragic ending of this story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, my fellow warrior, for believing in me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's one more thing. We should return to the Central Hub in Septimont. I found something tied to you there, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Central Hub... Good timing. There's something I need to handle in the Vale of Glory too.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good, let's set off together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When Lupa vanished, I destroyed the experimental unit, pursued the Threnodian, and defeated the Lioness of Glory It controlled. Then I came across this place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You remember how the Threnodian took on a part of the Sentinel's knowledge and permissions, yes?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For the Sentinel, the information stolen was Their very memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For this reason, even the Sentinel forgot that before merging with the Threnodian, They transferred some of their knowledge to the Central Hub in Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The knowledge They would later forget...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was a secret, one the Threnodian should never learn. The Sentinel moved it there for safekeeping.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Within it, I found a special frequency. A part of it... felt like yours. I believe it's what the Sentinel left for you. So I took it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You feel a faint frequency of sharp, cold wind. It fades quickly as it touches your hand, but not before it points towards a distant destination in Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems like a clue... the true secret They left for you is not here but in that direction.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You see, before I came to meet you, I passed by the city of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The arena I destroyed has been restored, but in the people's hearts, it's still {PlayerName} and Lupa who claimed victory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus's power to reshape reality is deeper than we realized. I'm afraid this is just the beginning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I once believed the Threnodian sought to use the Fractsidus to regain power, but Its true goal is the Central Hub. I believe it's due to this secret the Sentinel has hidden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That direction... It leads to the hunting grounds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The <te href=850171>Blightcloud</te> still lingers there. When the <te href=850159>High Tide</te> comes, Septimontians hunt and cull the spawning Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide... connects everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I cannot pinpoint where the Sentinel's message lies. I'm afraid you must go there yourself, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the worst of the storm has passed. Let's take a moment to rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa, will you be our tour guide? Show us the sights and glories of Septimont?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd love to hear more about what you mentioned earlier. The wind blowing through golden flags and the sound of wind chimes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course! It would be my honor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But before we go, there's something I need to do first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The three of you arrive at the Central Hub where you learn Imperator left behind a message before merging with Leviathan. The message points to the hunting grounds in Septimont.

A storm brews on the horizon, but after a long journey, it's time for a moment of rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's Mya's sword. I went through a lot to bring it back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The monster is gone now. Like so many Septimontian heroes whose bodies were never recovered, I... wanted to return her weapon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is where she gave her life. I can't say if she loved or hated Septimont more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... she once spoke of the Bloodleaf Viburnum. It's a tribute often given to Gladiators by their supporters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, I think... she would have wanted to rest here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's beautiful...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our city, the City of Glory. The people here love to drink, laugh, carve statues, and hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It burns like fire, drenched in both victory and defeat. It holds all our disappointments and all our hopes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mya's sword lies among the countless weapons in the Vale of Glory, just like every hero who once fought for Septimont. They stand guard over a city drenched in both victory and defeat, holding both disappointment and hope.
